column4: it's a male female cable in it it's a jack to rc and rc goes int-o my system , in windows 7 I can select both 2.0 and 5.1 settings
is it a digital output? otherwise analogue 5.1 is impossible on two channels
one jack usually is stereo out, some have three channels, look at the male connector and count the plastic rings, they separate the channels

two rings would be three channels, that is usuall used on systems with only two jacks, so two jacks would have 2x3=6 channels. On Windows my audiochip has a driver which can do virtual surround over stereo output, that is not 5.1. On ubuntu what you see in pavucontrol is the physical config, and for me even in windows it is set to stereo, or headphones, and the virtual surround is a different setting. On linux, the media
